Job Title: Principal, Executive Compensation

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
CURRENT ROOT EMPLOYEES - Please apply using the career page in Workday. This career site is for external applicants only.

The Opportunity

Root is hiring a Principal, Executive Compensation to join our team! Reporting to the Senior Director, Total Rewards and HR Operations, you'll have the opportunity to build upon and support the administration of our global equity program, design of our long-term incentives, and preparation of materials for the Compensation Committee of Root’s Board of Directors. We want you to bring your expertise in all things related to executive compensation and your passion for excellent customer service to all levels of equity participants.

Root is a “work where it works best” company. Meaning we will support you working in whatever location that works best for you across the US. We will continue to have our headquarters in Columbus and offices in other locations to give more flexibility and more choice about how we live and work.

Salary Range: $136,000 - $170,000

How You Will Make An Impact

Model cost and share usage of potential long-term incentive program designs.Draft the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section of Root’s annual Proxy Statement.Draft meeting materials of Root’s Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors.Coordinate with Root’s Corporate Secretary to ensure prompt and accurate SEC filings related to executive compensation.Provide benchmarking support for senior leadership roles.Administer Root’s equity programs which includes maintaining the equity database integrity, ensuring accuracy of record keeping, processing new equity awards, and processing restricted stock unit and performance stock unit distributions.Coordinate with Root’s accounting and finance teams to ensure proper budgeting and accounting of Root’s equity compensation programs.Manage and track new issuance, shares outstanding, and shares available under the Root’s stock plans.Serve as a point of contact for employee questions and concerns related to equity.Develop and deliver equity-related education materials and other employee communications.Partner with People Team leadership on ad hoc projects as needed, including but not limited to broad based compensation program support.

What You Will Need To Succeed

5+ years of experience in executive compensation.Experience with U.S. federal and state taxation relating to equity compensation and general knowledge of global taxation.Understanding of accounting standards relating to equity compensation.Collaborative spirit and ability to work with a variety of cross-functional partners in Finance, Legal, etc.Familiar with all equity vehicles (options, RSUs, PSUs, etc.).Strong Excel skills, ability to leverage complex formulas and modeling.Knowledge of HR reporting and information systems.Excellent analytical capabilities, organizational skills, and dedication to getting the details just right.A passion for equity and helping our employees understand it.A penchant for discretion when it comes to sensitive information.

Don’t meet every single requirement?

Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Root, Inc., we are dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway!

Join us

At Root, we judge people based on the merit of their work, not who they are. If you are passionate about what this role entails and solving real problems, we encourage you to apply. We want to learn about you and what you can add to our team.

Who We Are

We’re harnessing the power of technology to revolutionize insurance. Using machine learning and mobile telematic platforms, we’ve built one of the most innovative FinTech companies in the world. And we’re just getting started.

What Draws People To Root

Our success is in large part due to our unwavering standards in hiring. We recognize that our products are only as good as the people building and promoting them. We want individuals who find solutions by going through the cycle of ideation to implementation with curiosity, rigor, and an analytical lens. Ask anyone who works here and you’ll hear similar reasons for why they joined:

Autonomy—for assertive self-starters, the opportunities to contribute are limitless.

Impact—by challenging the way it’s always been done, we solve problems that have a big impact on our business.

Collaboration—we encourage rich discussion and civil debate at every turn.

People—we are inspired by the collection of crazy-smart people around us.

Experience Level (if available): Executive
